member.name: T:Spz.NET.Fixed24
member.summary: A 24-bit fixed-point number with a given amount of fractional bits.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Fixed24.#ctor(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a 24-bit fixed-point number from a floating-point value.
member.param: The number to be converted to a fixed representation.
The number of bits dedicated to representing the fractional portion.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Fixed24.#ctor(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates a 24-bit fixed-point number from 3 bytes.
member.param: Byte 1.
Byte 2.
Byte 3.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Fixed24.ToFloat(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts this fixed-point number to a floating point representation with a given number of fractional bits.
member.param: The number of bits dedicated to representing the fractional portion.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Fixed24.MaxValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: The maximum value that this fixed-point number can represent with a given amount of fractional bits.
member.param: The number of bits dedicated to representing the fractional portion.
member.returns: A floating-point number representing the maximum value that can be represented.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Fixed24.MinValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: The minimum value that this fixed-point number can represent with a given amount of fractional bits.
member.param: The number of bits dedicated to representing the fractional portion.
member.returns: A floating-point number representing the minimum value that can be represented.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Helpers.FixedPointHelpers.ToFixed(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a floating-point value into a 24-bit fixed-point number with a specified amount of bits to represent the fractional portion.
member.param: Number to convert.
Bits dedicated to the fractional portion.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Helpers.FixedPointHelpers.ToFixed(System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a Vector3 value into a 24-bit fixed-point Vector with a specified amount of bits to represent the fractional portion of each component.
member.param: Vector to convert.
Bits dedicated to the fractional portion.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Helpers.FixedPointHelpers.ByteClamp(System.Single)
member.summary: Ensures a float is within 0-255 range to ensure safe byte casting.
member.param: The float to clamp.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Helpers.SplatMathHelpers.Quantize(Spz.NET.GaussianHarmonics@,System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Quantizes a gaussian's spherical harmonics for improved compression performance.
5 bits are used for the first 3 coefficients (9 components), and 4 bits are used for the rest.
member.param: The harmonics to quantize.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Helpers.SplatMathHelpers.Unquantize(System.Span{System.Byte},Spz.NET.GaussianHarmonics@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Unquantizes a gaussian's spherical harmonics.
member.para: 5 bits are used for the first 3 coefficients (9 components), and 4 bits are used for the rest.
member.param: The harmonics to unquantize.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Helpers.SplatMathHelpers.QuantizeSH(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Quantizes a single component of a spherical harmonic's coefficients to a specified bucket size.
member.param: The component value.
The size of the bucket to quantize to.
member.returns: A quantized representation of the component.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Helpers.SplatMathHelpers.UnquantizeSH(System.Byte)
member.summary: Unquantizes a single component of a spherical harmonic's coefficients.
member.param: The quantized value.
member.returns: An unquantized representation of the component.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Helpers.SplatMathHelpers.DimForDegree(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the number of coefficients for a given degree of spherical harmonics.
member.param: The degree of spherical harmonics.
member.returns: The dimensions, or number of coefficients for the given degree.
member.exception: Thrown when a non-supported degree of spherical harmonic is requested.

member.name: M:Spz.NET.Helpers.SplatMathHelpers.DegreeForDim(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the degree of spherical harmonics for a given number of coefficients.
member.param: The coefficients in the spherical harmonic.

[RRR]

[RGB]

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ConstantExpectedAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the specified method parameter expects a constant.

member.summary: Indicates the minimum bound of the expected constant, inclusive.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ConstantExpectedAttribute.Max
member.summary: Indicates the maximum bound of the expected constant, inclusive.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that an API is experimental and it may change in the future.
member.remarks: This attribute allows call sites to be flagged with a diagnostic that indicates that an experimental feature is used. Authors can use this attribute to ship preview features in their assemblies.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.param: The ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.DiagnosticId
member.summary: Gets the ID that the compiler will use when reporting a use of the API the attribute applies to.
member.remarks:
The diagnostic ID is shown in build output for warnings and errors.
This property represents the unique ID that can be used to suppress the warnings or errors, if needed.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.ExperimentalAttribute.UrlFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL for corresponding documentation. The API accepts a format string instead of an actual URL, creating a generic URL that includes the diagnostic ID.
member.value: The format string that represents a URL to corresponding documentation.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnscopedRefAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate a byref escapes and is not scoped.

remarks.para: There are several cases where the C# compiler treats a as implicitly - where the compiler does not allow the to escape the method.

For example:
for instance methods.
parameters that refer to types.
parameters.
This attribute is used in those instances where the should be allowed to escape.

Applying this attribute, in any form, has impact on consumers of the applicable API. It is necessary for API authors to understand the lifetime implications of applying this attribute and how it may impact their users.

member.name: T:System.Index
member.summary: Represent a type can be used to index a collection either from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Construct an Index using a value and indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.param: The index value. it has to be zero or positive number.
Indicating if the index is from the start or from the end.
member.remarks: If the Index constructed from the end, index value 1 means pointing at the last element and index value 0 means pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: P:System.Index.Start
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at first element.

member.name: P:System.Index.End
member.summary: Create an Index pointing at beyond last element.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the start at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the start.

member.name: M:System.Index.FromEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Create an Index from the end at the position indicated by the value.
member.param: The index value from the end.

member.name: P:System.Index.Value
member.summary: Returns the index value.

member.name: P:System.Index.IsFromEnd
member.summary: Indicates whether the index is from the start or the end.

member.name: M:System.Index.GetOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the offset from the start using the giving collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the Index will be used with. length has to be a positive value
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter and the returned offset value against negative values. we don't validate either the returned offset is greater than the input length. It is expected Index will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. If the returned offset is negative and then used to index a collection will get out of range exception which will be same affect as the validation.

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.Equals(System.Index)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current Index object is equal to another Index object.
member.param: An object to compare with this object

member.name: M:System.Index.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.name: M:System.Index.op_Implicit(System.Int32)~System.Index
member.summary: Converts integer number to an Index.

member.name: M:System.Index.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current Index object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: P:System.Range.All
member.summary: Create a Range object starting from first element to the end.

member.name: M:System.Range.GetOffsetAndLength(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculate the start offset and length of range object using a collection length.
member.param: The length of the collection that the range will be used with. length has to be a positive value.
member.remarks: For performance reason, we don't validate the input length parameter against negative values. It is expected Range will be used with collections which always have non negative length/count. We validate the range is inside the length scope though.

member.remarks: This should match the metadata name of the target method. For example, this might be ".ctor" if targeting the type's constructor.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InterpolatedStringHandlerAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the attributed type is to be used as an interpolated string handler.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsExternalInit
member.summary: Reserved to be used by the compiler for tracking metadata. This class should not be used by developers in source code.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ModuleInitializerAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that a method should be called in its containing module's initializer.
member.remarks:
When one or more valid methods with this attribute are found in a compilation, the compiler will emit a module initializer which calls each of the attributed methods.
Certain requirements are imposed on any method targeted with this attribute: - The method must be `static`. - The method must be an ordinary member method, as opposed to a property accessor, constructor, local function, etc. - The method must be parameterless. - The method must return `void`. - The method must not be generic or be contained in a generic type. - The method's effective accessibility must be `internal` or `public`.
The specification for module initializers in the .NET runtime can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/design/specs/Ecma-335-Augments.md#module-initializer

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the priority of a member in overload resolution. When unspecified, the default priority is 0.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The priority of the attributed member. Higher numbers are prioritized, lower numbers are deprioritized. 0 is the default if no attribute is present.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.Priority
member.summary: The priority of the member.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ParamCollectionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method will allow a variable number of arguments in its invocation.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiredMemberAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that a type has required members or that a member is required.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.RequiresLocationAttribute
member.summary: Reserved for use by a compiler for tracking metadata. This attribute should not be used by developers in source code.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.SkipLocalsInitAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that the .locals init flag should not be set in method headers.
